result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah U Atkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 08-24-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample.
*With credit for 4 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. If the defendant commits no new crimes, Court will grant expungement after 1 year.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah U Atkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: If the defendant commits no new crimes, Court will grant expungement after 1 year.

Defendant Jeremiah U Atkins in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 08-24-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample.  If the defendant commits no new crimes, Court will grant expungement after 1 year.

Defendant Jeremiah U Atkins in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel would like to proceed with a plea/sentencing today but due to the lateness of the hour, Court ordered case adjourned.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing scheduled on February 24, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 21.

Defendant Jeremiah U Atkins in court with attorney Robert Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for a DPAH but the defendant is not eligible for a DPA.  Attorney Hampton is newly appointed on this matter and needs time to review discovery and the offer with the defendant.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Same conditions to apply.

Defendant Jeremiah U Atkins in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  The defendant appeared late.  Court ordered the warrant canceled and bail reinstated.  The signed warrant remains in the file.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court earlier.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant Jeremiah U Atkins in court with attorney Reyna Morales for Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel is working on resolving this matter with a DPA.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services "Court Reminders."  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jeremiah U Atkins in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Defendant Jeremiah U Atkins in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($150.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 150.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court earlier.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant Jeremiah U Atkins in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremiah U Atkins in court with attorney Matthew Lamke for attorney Francisco Araiza.  
Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Pretrial conference.  Attorney Araiza did not appear.  Due to the lateness of the hour adjourned date selected.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jeremiah U Atkins in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Jeremiah U Atkins in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
